content: A collection of various interconnected computers that seems a single coherent system to its client is considered as?

What is the function of DSLAM?
options: Convert analog signals into digital signals
Convert digital signals into analog signals
answer: Convert analog signals into digital signals

content: Which of the following is the multiple access protocol for channel access control?

options: uses a three-way handshake to establish a connection
receives data from application as a single stream

content: If a link transmits 4000 frames per second, and each slot has 8 bits, the transmission rate of this TDM circuit is? in kbps

In a network, if P is the only packet being transmitted and there was no earlier transmission, which of the following delays could be zero?
Which one of the following is an application architecture paradigm?
Application developer has permission to decide which of the following on the transport layer side?
options: Both Transport layer protocol and Maximum buffer size
answer: Both Transport layer protocol and Maximum buffer size

content: Which is a time-sensitive service?
Which one of the following protocols delivers/stores mail to the receiver server?
In the process of fetching a web page from a server, the persistent HTTP request/response takes how many RTTs?
Which of the following is NOT correct about Web cache?
options: Web cache doesn't have its own disk space
Web cache can act both like server and client
Web cache might reduce the response time
Web cache contains copies of recently requested objects
answer: Web cache doesn't have its own disk space

It transfers files from one mail server to another mail server
SMTP is responsible for the transmission of the mail through the internet

content: What happens if a server has no clue about where to find the address for a hostname?

options: multiple hostnames may correspond to a single IP address
a single hostname may correspond to many IP addresses
a single hostname may correspond to a single IP address

content: IP assigned for a client by a DHCP server is:

When a host acquires multiple offers of IP addresses from different DHCP servers, the host will broadcast a DHCP request identifying the server whose offer has been accepted. The DHCP server can provide the ____ of the IP addresses.
In TCP, sending and receiving data is done in which format?
TCP processes may not write and read data at the same speed. So, what do we need for storage?
To achieve reliable transport in TCP, which mechanism is used to check the safe and sound arrival of data?
Suppose a TCP connection is transferring a file of 1000 bytes. The first byte is numbered 10001. What is the sequence number of the segment if all data is sent in only one segment?
The mechanism where the receiver of the data controls the amount of data that are to be sent by the sender is referred to as:
Which field allows TCP to detect lost segments and in turn recover from that loss?
What is the main advantage of UDP?
Which is the correct expression for the length of a UDP datagram?
options: UDP length = IP length - IP header's length
UDP length = UDP length - UDP header's length
UDP length = IP length + IP header's length
UDP length = UDP length + UDP header's length
answer: UDP length = IP length - IP header's length

content: In Go-Back-N window, when the timer of the packet times out, several packets have to be resent. Whereas in Selective Repeat window, the sender resends which packets?
options: Only those packets which are lost or corrupted
answer: Only those packets which are lost or corrupted

content: In the slow-start algorithm, the size of the congestion window increases until it reaches a threshold. How does it increase?
A web cookie is a small piece of data that is:
options: sent from a website and stored in user's web browser while a user is browsing a website
sent from user and stored in the server while a user is browsing a website
sent from root server to all servers
sent from the root server to other root servers
answer: sent from a website and stored in user's web browser while a user is browsing a website

content: Which of the following is not applicable for the single Internet Protocol (IP)?
Which field helps to check rearrangement of the fragments for an IP packet?

Which of the following is false with respect to Connectionless service of a layer protocol?
options: Packet may arrive out of sequence

content: Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) has been designed to compensate for what from Internet Protocol (IP)?
The Time-to-Live (TTL) field in an IP header has a value of 10. How many routers (max) can process this datagram?
IPv6 does not use which type of address?
You have an IP address of 172.16.13.5 with a 255.255.255.128 subnet mask. What is your class of address, subnet address, and broadcast address?
If you wanted to have 12 subnets with a Class C network ID, which subnet mask would you use?

Your router has the IP address 172.16.2.1/23 on Ethernet0. Which of the following can be valid host IDs on the LAN interface attached to the router? (i. 172.16.1.100, ii. 172.16.1.198, iii. 172.16.2.255, iv. 172.16.3.0)
What is the maximum number of IP addresses that can be assigned to hosts on a local subnet that uses the 255.255.255.224 subnet mask?
You have an interface on a router with the IP address of 192.168.192.10/29. Including the router interface, how many hosts can have IP addresses on the LAN attached to the router interface?
Where should we use default routing?
options: On stub networks - which have only one exit path out of the network
Which have more than one exit path out of the network
Minimum five exit paths out of the network
Maximum five exit paths out of the network
answer: On stub networks - which have only one exit path out of the network

content: What is route poisoning?
options: It sends back the protocol received from a router as a poison pill
It is information received from a router that can't be sent back to the originating router
It prevents regular update messages from reinstating a route that has just come up
It describes when a router sets the metric for a downed link to infinity
answer: It describes when a router sets the metric for a downed link to infinity

content: Which methods are commonly used in the ServerSocket class?

options: Both IP address of Server & Port number
answer: Both IP address of Server & Port number

content: Cookies were originally designed for:
options: Both Client-side programming and Server-side programming

options: Sends newer LSU update to source router
Floods the LSA to the other routers

content: The outcome of Dijkstra's calculation is used to populate which table?

ICMP is used in which application?
ISPs exchange internet traffic between their networks by:
Host A wants to send a request to a Web server HTTPS. Which of the following could be the source address when the Server receives the data frame?
options: MAC address of the switch connected to host A
MAC address of the switch connected to Server
MAC address of the router A at interface Fa0/0
MAC address of the router A at interface Fa0/1
answer: MAC address of the router A at interface Fa0/1

content: Consider the figure below. What are the source/destination port values and the source/destination IP addresses in the network-layer datagrams (carrying the transport-layer segments) flowing from the server back to the clients' processes?
options: Source port: 80, IP Source: B; Destination port: 26145, Destination IP: A
Source port: 26145, IP Source: A; Destination port: 80, Destination IP: B
Source port 80, IP Source: A; Destination port: 26145, Destination IP: B
Source port 80, IP source C; Destination port: 7532, Destination IP: B
answer: Source port: 80, IP Source: B; Destination port: 26145, Destination IP: A
